Package org.zaproxy.zap.spider.filters

Class HttpPrefixFetchFilter

java.lang.Object
org.zaproxy.zap.spider.filters.FetchFilter
org.zaproxy.zap.spider.filters.HttpPrefixFetchFilter
@Deprecated public class HttpPrefixFetchFilter extends FetchFilter
Deprecated.
(2.12.0) See the spider add-on in zap-extensions instead.
A FetchFilter that filters based on a HTTP or HTTPS URI.

The filtered URIs are required to start with the URI (the prefix) to be considered valid.

Since:
2.5.0
See Also:
  • checkFilter(URI)

  • Constructor Details

    • HttpPrefixFetchFilter

      public HttpPrefixFetchFilter(org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI prefix)
      Deprecated.
      Constructs a HttpPrefixFetchFilter using the given URI as prefix.

      The user info, query component and fragment of the given URI are discarded. The scheme and domain comparisons are done in a case insensitive way while the path component comparison is case sensitive.

      Parameters:
      prefix - the URI that will be used as prefix
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the following conditions is true:
      • The given prefix is null;
      • The given prefix has null scheme;
      • The scheme of the given prefix is not HTTP or HTTPS;
      • The given prefix has null host;
      • The given prefix has malformed host.

  • Method Details

    • getNormalisedPrefix

      public String getNormalisedPrefix()
      Deprecated.
      Gets the prefix normalised, as it is used to filter the URIs.
      Returns:
      a String with the prefix normalised
      See Also:
      • checkFilter(URI)

    • checkFilter

      public FetchFilter.FetchStatus checkFilter(org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI uri)
      Deprecated.
      Filters any URI that does not start with the defined prefix.
      Specified by:
      checkFilter in class FetchFilter
      Parameters:
      uri - the uri to be processed
      Returns:
      FetchStatus.VALID if the uri starts with the prefix, FetchStatus.OUT_OF_SCOPE otherwise
